trends: There have been 43 other sightings in Lexington
There were no other sightings in Lexington on or around May 16th 2000
divs: Sighting Detailsme and my friend steven were traveling on highway 1876 around 8:00 pm,on the border of bourbon and lexington.we saw a very bright spot light signaling on the other side of the hill.steven turned his head lights off,and said look its the bat signal.i laughft and said it was a air port becon ,but he said there was no airport over there.when we got over the hill we saw a huge structure.the back of it was a huge dome and in the front was a smaller dome with a couple of rows of the spot lights we were seeing.and on the smaller dome was a golden cross that came out of the top.to the left was a vertical disk shaped object that was blue.it all was shinning like it was covered in florecent light.the domes were a redish color.the first thing i said was is this the coming of christ.we were approching this structure fast.we pulled over to the side.i dont think it knew we were there.because of steven turning his headlight off.then the cross started to spin really fast,and orbs started flying everywhere.then the blue wheel started to charge and a energy field covered the object like a huge dome.you could see electric veins inside the energy field and we could feal the static.then with out any warning it dissipeared like it changed frequencies.this happened in a feild on a horse farm there is a couple of houses around the area but no one else was around.we ran to the spot it was at and we kept saying it was right here.it took me four years to acctually start investigating ufos.i have read alot of books on the subject and have not found too much info on what we saw.i have found some clues.and i have seen two other objects in the sky that may be linked to this machine,but what we saw was on the ground and we were close enough to see it work,i strongly believe that it was a interdiminsional time machine.i hope i can get answers and and help advise anyone who would want to investigate. ronnie kenner
